issues.title: Move away from using `targeted_id` and towards a standard of `persistent_id`
issues.body:
Previously most AAF applications have relied on a combination of `eduPersonSharedToken` and `eduPersonEntitlement` when identifying users.

This is seen within lipstick where calls are made to `Subject#targeted_id` within helpers (and likely elsewhere).

Moving forward our applications will need to start to rely on Persistent SAML NameID, `persistent_id` rather than directly on `eduPersonTargetedID`. 

Lipstick and Gumboot need to be upgraded at the same time to handle this change and both will require major version releases to propagate the change in a compatible manner.

issues.title: Instructions for Sprockets + Email need refining for Rails 5
issues.body:
On Rails 5 using `register_engine` within `application.rb` results in:

```
DEPRECATION WARNING: Sprockets method `register_engine` is deprecated.
Please register a mime type using `register_mime_type` then
use `register_compressor` or `register_transformer`.
https://github.com/rails/sprockets/blob/master/guides/extending_sprockets.md#supporting-all-versions-of-sprockets-in-processors
 (called from <top (required)> at /Users/bradleybeddoes/Development/aaf/services/oidc-service/config/application.rb:24)
```

Lipstick README and dependent applications will need to be migrated.

Merge pull request #68 from ausaccessfed/feature/no-inline-js

Don't use inline Javascript
Address rubocop warning

Fix gem require error, String#squish, for Rails 5

Under rails 5 applications the following would be ommitted when doing a
`Bundle.require(:default)` calls, as our Ansible deployment process
does currently:

```
~/.rbenv/versions/2.3.1/lib/ruby/gems/2.3.0/gems/bundler-1.12.5/lib/bundler/runtime.rb:89:in
`rescue in block (2 levels) in require': There was an error while trying
to load the gem 'aaf-lipstick'. (Bundler::GemRequireError)
Gem Load Error is: undefined method `squish' for #<String
```

This was tracked back to
https://github.com/rails/rails/commit/cacded5a0e0acc0582c2778b9dd8df684451ad53#diff-fd5aa4f57129021fa45feb7a445a2f8e

Which now makes the use of active_support provided methods a requirement
on this global. In our specific case active_support is not yet fully
loaded by the rails environment when this is required due to our usage
of `isolate_namespace`.

Specifically requiring the piece of active_support that action_dispatch
is relying on here addresses the issue.

Merge pull request #66 from ausaccessfed/bugfix/sprockets-warnings-rails-4.2.7.1

Silence sprockets deprecation warning
Add note about why we silence sprockets to README
Update README with sprockets deprecation details
Address Rubocop warnings

Silence sprockets deprecation warning

Sprockets 4.x is deprecating `register_engine` which results in our
systems spewing out the following:

```
DEPRECATION WARNING: Sprockets method `register_engine` is deprecated.
Please register a mime type using `register_mime_type` then
use `register_compressor` or `register_transformer`.
https://github.com/rails/sprockets/blob/master/guides/extending_sprockets.md#supporting-all-versions-of-sprockets-in-processors
 (called from <top (required)> at
 /Users/bradleybeddoes/Development/aaf/services/aaf-lipstick/sample/rails/config/application.rb:25)
```

This commit silences the warning whilst we're still on Sprockets 3.x.

An issue to re-write `Lipstick::Images::Processor` to be compliant has
already been logged at
https://github.com/ausaccessfed/aaf-lipstick/issues/65. I've started to
investigate this but hit a brick wall (time AND ability wise :P) before
I got fully working solution in place. Will discuss with @smangesldorf
who has a better understanding on sprockets internals on his return to
the AAF.

The change tested in `config/application.rb` will be deployed to other
AAF rails apps in the interim.

Finished in 0.34647 seconds (files took 0.75584 seconds to load)
32 examples, 0 failures

Randomized with seed 13184

Worth documenting extra param in README under Email Template header?
Travis is clearly working but I am hitting the following locally https://gist.github.com/bradleybeddoes/478dd83a1e07c7bacc92 thoughts?
Upgrading 2.2.0 to 2.2.1 fixed the issue for me.

Rubocop version change isn't being reflected in gemspec, thus when I run locally I am still receiving the following after a `bundal install` is run:

```
Inspecting 47 files
..C............................................

Offenses:

Guardfile:7:9: C: Use %r only for regular expressions matching more than 1 '/' character.
  watch(%r{^spec/.+_spec\.rb$})
...
```

Are you seeing the same?

Nice sample buttons
![nice](http://cdn.sheknows.com/articles/crave/rainbow-lipstick-chick.jpg)

Have reviewed in sample app and IdE branch, happy with both, discussion of Lato aside.

This is probably best taken as a jumping off point to lipstick 2.x given breaking changes.

Tested with certs and sample app in same browser.

Confirmed sample app no longer exhibits the content reduction issue at 1560px+.

Overall looking good.

Minor quibbles:
- Link hover in footer makes the text almost disappear, it is a similar blue to background - [teh hoverz](https://www.dropbox.com/s/q28qrv8a6r14sla/Screenshot%202016-01-06%2013.21.22.png?dl=0)
- Email branding still outstanding (as discussed this is expected). I'd suggest we dump the social media stuff from that or at least refine it. Facebook especially doesn't get used by EA / AAF is my understanding.
- form.html.slim L39 h1 should be `form_tag` - seems to be a carry over from previous code
- Should we change `Developed for the Australian Access Federation by Shaun Mangelsdorf` in the example to `Developed by the Australian Access Federation`?. I don't have a strong view on this but I've been coming down on the side of not adding my name in the footer recently.
- I have some opinions on the colours etc not gelling but given this is new AAF corporate branding these aren't relevant ;-).

Apart from the above I am happy to merge, will await your comments.
@JakeSchoermer - done
This was reviewed by @toomaj but I clicked the button so as to make a 15:00 deadline for test federation Ansible run.
![kanye approves](https://m.popkey.co/1427ad/z9xKp.gif)
Will need some co-ordination with rest of the dev team to ensure they're comfortable with timing etc.
Note https://github.com/ausaccessfed/aaf-lipstick/issues/73 in reference to this ticket. Hence accepting reliance on `activepack` and `activerecord` which we wouldn't have previously.
Ok @rcaught finally this got through CI bullshit and can be merged.

Other relevant PR associated with this change:
- https://github.com/ausaccessfed/aaf-gumboot/issues/50
- https://github.com/ausaccessfed/shib-rack/issues/15
- https://github.com/ausaccessfed/rapid-rack/issues/10

There may also be need to consider a `shared_persistent_id` value that is populated from `auEduPersonSharedToken` or in the future `eduPersonUniqueId` http://software.internet2.edu/eduperson/internet2-mace-dir-eduperson-201602.html#eduPersonUniqueId as opposed to our current reliance on calling this `auEduPersonSharedToken`

Merge release 2.1.0 into master
Backported release 2.1.0 into develop
Version bump to 2.1.0
Rubocop fix
Rubocop fixes

Sample Rails app updated to use the new errors

- Upgraded to Rails 5
- Added an ApplicationController
- Static and Dynamic errors

Static error generation

Apache, etc. will look for files like public/404.html for 404, 422 and
500.  These errors are outside the application, so this allows us to
generate the above errors through an initializer.  Git ignoring the
files respects their dynamic generation on each application startup.

The current inlined, compiled CSS code is not the road I wanted to go
but due to time constraints, it's the best I can come up with.

Dynamic errors

Each Rails app is redefining the same error pages.  This allows a
simple include to reduce the copied logic.

Merge pull request #81 from ausaccessfed/bugfix/action_view_require

Action View require for bootstrap_form_builder.rb

Merge pull request #78 from ausaccessfed/feature/allow_blank_targeted_id

Support non federated subjects
Disable BlockLength cop for gemspec / RSpec files
Fixes #73
Relocate Filterable model to use dummy application
Use dummy Rails application for tests
Move requires into spec_helper.rb

Require 'rails' for test runs

Requiring individual components of Rails was not working after removing
the conditional includes.
Remove unneeded definition of `Rails.application`

Remove SprocketsAssetDataURL monkey patch

This is provided by sass-rails, and was never needed for Rails apps.

Remove CompatibilityHacks helper

This was built to fill a gap in Sinatra apps, but is no longer needed.
Remove unnecessary conditional requires
Depend on Rails 4.x/5.x directly
Remove Sinatra sample application
Remove Sinatra info from README.md
Add shotgun to sample/rails gems, and update
Remove unused parameter
Apply JSON validations to forms automatically

Use custom script tag with JSON for validations

With our applications moving towards Content-Security-Policy across the
board, it makes the most sense to avoid using inline JS for our form
validations. As of #35, we're already building a JSON structure which
describes all our validations. This takes the next step, so instead of:

    <script type="text/javascript">
    jQuery(function($) { $(selector).validate({...json...}); });
    </script>

It will instead be:

    <script type="application/vnd.aaf.lipstick.validations+json"
            target="selector" ...>
    {...json...}
    </script>

Add Rakefile to sample Rails application

Allows us to run `rake assets:precompile` in the sample app.

Refactor to use Sprockets environment via @context

When deployed in production, the combination of Sprockets 3.6.3 and
Rails 4.2.6 caused `rake assets:precompile` to fail, due to the way the
sprockets environment was resolved in this Processor. After upgrading
to these versions, `Rails.application.assets` is `nil` in the context
we're using it here.

Conveniently, Sprockets gives us its environment within the `@context`
which is provided to the Processor. It works, and also seems like the
more correct way to handle it.

Update Gemfile.lock in Rails sample app

Running `bundle` kept insisting that `tilt` be added to Gemfile.lock.
Must have been missed in an earlier commit.

Merge pull request #63 from ausaccessfed/feature/update-button-conventions-to-use-btn-toolbar

Use bootstrap's `btn-toolbar` for grouping buttons

Merge pull request #62 from ausaccessfed/bugfix/rails-5-needs-tilt

Tilt dependency

Merge pull request #61 from ausaccessfed/feature/unlock-sprockets-version

Unlock sprockets version

Require 'lipstick/version'

Though not typically required for applications that use Lipstick, it is
a bug that this file is not loaded.

Ref: #59

Clarify intention of sample layout in README

Fixes #59

Merge pull request #57 from ausaccessfed/feature/override-password-field

Override password_field with AAF form CSS
Add notes about sizing / whitespace on buttons
Add page describing button conventions

Merge pull request #54 from ausaccessfed/feature/w3c-validator-compliance

Update page layout after w3c validation

Merge pull request #53 from ausaccessfed/bugfix/duplicated-footer

Remove duplicated <footer> element in layout

Use Sprockets require instead of SCSS @import

The latter was not working correctly for production deployment.
Add CSRF test to Rails sample app

Use CSRF protection correctly in delete button

Our delete_button_tag helper didn't correctly make use of the CSRF token
from the `<head>`, and so the requests were being rejected by the
server.

Fix detection of Rails' checkboxes

When dealing with Rails' checkboxes, the validations can also run
against the hidden field which accompanies the checkbox. This changes
the logic to detect a hidden field which is a checkbox's sibling and has
the same name, and places the validation error message correctly after
the label

Wrap before subheader for better aesthetics

The default Bootstrap style for header / subheader is a bit strange.

Fix validation error placement for radio/checkbox

The default behaviour is to insert validation errors into the DOM
immediately after the `<input>`, which obviously doesn't work for radio
/ checkbox fields and messes up the UI completely.

This change handles the two types of field specially, as they need the
error rendered differently.
Update page_header helper to correct style

Restructure to fix Sinatra example application

As Sinatra doesn't include Arel, it can't make use of the Filterable
feature which has always required Arel, but was never feature-gated as
such.

Add explicit case-insensitive collation to filters

With Gumboot's new requirement of utf8_bin collation on all databases,
we now need to explicitly specify case-insensitive collation where it is
needed.

Due to our Arel-based implementation, the cleanest approach was to add a
new AST node which adds explicit collation to an Arel::Attribute.

This required a wrapper class which is aware of the attribute and the
necessary collation, as well as an extension to the AST visitor logic.
Add missing frozen_string_literal directive
Extract sprockets scss helper to a Lipstick module
Document Sinatra app configuration in README.md

Repair Sinatra app against latest Lipstick changes

The sample Sinatra app has been broken for some time, largely due to
incompatibility with rails-assets.org. As it happens, Torba has no such
issues, so fixing the Sinatra app is possible again :tada:
Switch Sinatra sample app to Torba
Remove remnants of rails-assets from the codebase

Update dependencies of Rails sample app

I guess it's been a while, and we don't want our sample app being hacked
:smirk:
Update README.md to reflect the switch to Torba
Add missing pickadate CSS asset to torba import

Repair Sprockets require directives for new paths

Torba uses a different directory structure compared to rails-assets.org
Add torba requires to Rails project setup
Switch to Torba for managing sample app assets

Some issues with Sinatra::Capture were preventing it working correctly
with Lipstick. We already had a working `capture` implemented for our

(turn `debug` off to see asset compilation in action).

Load AutoValidation only if ActiveModel is defined

The padding-left and padding-right styles were being inherited from the

Repair delete_button_tag helper for Semantic 2.0

Prefix validation field names with underscore

A change in Semantic UI 2.0 means that a field named "identifier" will
be detected as being an "old style" parameter, which issues a console
warning.

This is a workaround for Semantic-Org/Semantic-UI#2629

Change javascript validations to the new API

As a nice side effect of how our validations worked, this is a very
small change. The new Semantic UI API for form validations only accepts
a single parameter containing all validations. That's how we have always
used it, so it's only a slight change to the object structure.
Add explicit source for rails-assets gems

Attempting to measure the metrics of a blank environment string caused
an exception, so we need to fake the metrics in that case.

Ignore Rubocop violations on current large modules

One day these violations can be worked around. Today is not that day.

Add will_paginate support + example

When starting with an initial value, the XML schema formatted date
was not parsed / reformatted. It needs to be explicitly set.
Add pickadate CSS + JS to README instructions
Show Australian date but submit in XML format
Add more information about pickadate.js bug

Updated things a little too
Add missing test coverage

Add CI configuration
Reduce code duplication in auto_validation_spec

Adjust documentation wording in line with feedback

Per #21

Remove explicit bullet style on validation errors

Added in 0ee7ae6 to resolve #9, but the newer version of Semantic makes
this style double up.

Allow customisation of auto validation field names

Some fields aren't correctly converted to a readable name automatically,
so the app will need to override the descriptive name.
Merge release 1.1.0 into master
Backported release 1.1.0 into develop
Bump version to 1.1.0

Add support for repeat validate_field calls

Calling `validate_field` multiple times (especially when calling
`auto_validate` and then augmenting after with extra validations) caused
all previously validations to be dropped and only those from the last
call would be applied.

We need to manually merge the validations.

Add support for configurable email template

Closes #16

Add test case that proves linking works

The missing piece was the surrounding <> on a literal link. No
functionality change needed be done.

Merge branch 'feature/delete-button-confirmation-text' into develop
Tidy up RSpec style

Adjust wording re: required attributes on Subject

It was identified that requiring a full Gumboot-compliant Subject model
was overkill, because this helper doesn't require any of the access
control logic that Gumboot mandates.

Given that we want to reserve the right to change the format of this
helper in future, it's useful to still require the attributes mandated
by Gumboot.
Perform auto validation based on model validations

Change validation errors to show as a proper list

Fixes #9
Fixed Rubocop violation

issue_comments.body: The gem name doesn't match the repo. Now that we're doing review it seems to be a source of error and confusion. Maybe I should back out that last commit and rename the repo?

Invalidate all the links!

Renamed.
Mind taking a quick look at this one @bradleybeddoes ?

In that example, the `message` is being copied verbatim into the validation errors. You need to provide a message which suits the purpose better.

Might be a good idea to make the errors show as dot points though (numbering is cool but the numbers would have no meaning at all).
Was locally pinned to an older Rubocop. Updated & fixed the violation.
Damn, GitHub properly shows that commit landing after your comment, so I can't even pretend I already did it.
The hash key is the field name
How would you suggest it be reworded to make it more clear?
Sorted.
Yeah, I plan to address that outside this PR.

Well, Travis isn't running the Rails sample app so this is probably legit... But then, it works over here.

The error seems to be in direct conflict with the output of `bundle install`. I'll do some more testing here to see if I can reproduce it.
As this is a gem project, `Gemfile.lock` is not committed. You'll need to update locally before that violation is resolved.

Minimal changes required to a Lipstick application. e.g.:

ausaccessfed/identity-enhancement-service@2dbb05b7e  

Check out the [`feature/update-dependencies`](https://github.com/ausaccessfed/identity-enhancement-service/tree/feature/update-dependencies) branch of IdE if you want something heavier than the Rails sample app to play with.

Alright, teething issues should be ironed out now. This is ready for review.

IdE branch has been updated: ausaccessfed/identity-enhancement-service@b9394bb
Oh man, this discussion makes a _lot_ more sense now that I know the context.
`Gemfile.lock` is not committed as part of a gem project. You just need to update your dependencies locally to get the newer Rubocop happening.

I completely agree with the removal of specific names from app footers. Especially given our development process, it neglects to mention people involved in code review, iterative testing and feedback, UI design choices, etc. Removed from here, and will remove from apps as they are converted to the new branding.

Email branding will be addressed in a future PR. Other comments have been addressed where possible.

![](http://www.bentbanani.com/images/bbunique4.jpg)
![](https://media.giphy.com/media/13FrpeVH09Zrb2/giphy.gif)
Out of interest, what's the error raised by sprockets?

`Lipstick::VERSION` is the gem version, and likely not what you want. The sample layout is a starting point, but should be entirely customised to the individual application before being committed.

Technically this is a bug, as the `lipstick/version` file **should** be required. However, this is only going to mask the larger problem of blindly copied code. I've tweaked the wording in the README to serve as an additional prompt in future.
![](http://i.imgur.com/2bHkk.gif)
FYI @ausaccessfed/aaf-devs

Everything on our side is comfortable with 2.0.0 being tagged. The gem has stabilised now since the new branding stuff was merged, and plenty of projects are using the `develop` branch without hassle.

The only thing I see coming early in the 2.x versions is some work on compatibility with Content-Security-Policy, if we hit any other issues there.

review_comments.body: That one's ok.

Currently, yes, it only requires an object with `name` and `targeted_id`.

It's overkill, but it's also a useful constraint to have if (for example) we want to change the format later to include email address and/or shared token.

Maybe a better wording would be: "Expects the Subject model to have all attributes mandated by Gumboot", which would achieve the same but not require accession and the related structure of roles/permissions.
Better?
[It's part of the Rails API](http://api.rubyonrails.org/classes/ActionView/Helpers/FormBuilder.html#method-i-select)
You win this round @rianniello

The original offense here is:

```
lib/lipstick/helpers/compatibility_hacks.rb:23:9: C: Use !empty? instead of length > 0.
        io.length > 0 ? io.string : result
        ^^^^^^^^^^^^^
```

This seems to just be masking the offense, rather than addressing it.

That's ... interesting. Today I learned that `StringIO` doesn't understand `.empty?`

Alright, leave it as-is... This is as good a fix as any.
Could this have been addressed simply by changing `link_to` to `button_to` in the `confirm_delete_dropdown` method (i.e. for the `delete_button_tag` helper)?
~~SimpleCov reports that this method isn't covered.~~ Sorted.

Since these changes aren't compatible with `sprockets < 3` (unless I've missed something), can we pin this to `~> 3.0`? Mostly, I'd like to be sure that our apps are going to upgrade cleanly to the newer version of Lipstick.

3.x seems to be explicitly compatible with Rails 4, which is great. I'm happy to ditch compatibility with Sprockets 2.x in that case.

The original intention behind this was that if we update the `logo.png` which ships with Lipstick, we want the `email_banner.png` asset to be recompiled on the deployed host. Using [`depend_on_asset`](https://github.com/rails/sprockets/blob/2.x/lib/sprockets/context.rb#L123-L134) caused the precompiled asset to be invalidated if `logo.png` changed.

Does Sprockets 3.x have something which achieves the same result?
This text about whitespace needs updating now?
FYI, this breaks the Sinatra example app.
This could be `base.rescue_from` (i.e. using the parameter supplied to the method), to avoid scoping the `rescue_from` globally.

commits.message: Remove trailing whitespace on spec description
Add missing spec for #79
Don't scope rescue_from globally, only mixin

Only load rescue_from if included as a mixin

The calls to `::ActionController::Base.rescue_from` were on the load
path, so even you didn't include the DynamicErrors mixin these would be
loaded.

Now these statements are wrapped in `self.included(_base)`
to be included conditionally.
Fix rubocop errors

Support non federated subjects

This removes the assumption that `logged_in_user` must work with a
targeted id. If no targeted id exists, don't output it.
Rework note about whitespace in buttons
Appease our rubocop overlords :cop:
Use bootstrap's `btn-toolbar` for grouping buttons

Update page layout after w3c validation

After running https://validator.w3.org the results were:

- `meta http-equiv='X-UA-Compatible' content='IE=Edge,chrome=1'` was for
  legacy IE support. I've removed this tag and tested on IE 9.
  No problems found from some local IE 9 testing.

- `head profile='http://www.w3.org/2005/10/profile'` has been obsoleted
  in html5. Removing this attribute does not affect any elements
  containing html metadata, (i.e. `<meta content="width=device-width,
  initial-scale=1.0" name="viewport" />`).

This change resolves these issues. Tested with IE, Firefox, Chrome, iOS,
Android (S5 + Chrome).

Resolves https://github.com/ausaccessfed/aaf-lipstick/issues/45.
Remove duplicated <footer> element in layout

Merge pull request #51 from ausaccessfed/bugfix/csrf-protection-in-delete-button

Fix handling of CSRF protection in delete button

Merge pull request #49 from ausaccessfed/bugfix/page-header

Update page_header helper to correct style

Merge pull request #50 from ausaccessfed/bugfix/validate-radio-buttons

Fix validation error placement for radio/checkbox

Right aligned aaf-links section on all resolutions

Attempted to modify the `responsive-width` sass mixins but since they're used
on a range of element types the change was too widespread / error prone.

Instead just added a special case `padding-right: 0px !important` rule to
the aaf-links header.

Made AAF footer stick to bottom of page

Verified on:

Safari
Chrome
Firefox
IE10
iOS 9 (Safari)
iOS 9 (Chrome)
Android 5 (Samsung S6 + Chrome)

Resolves https://github.com/ausaccessfed/aaf-lipstick/issues/37.

Fixed breaking banner in >= (1560px) resolutions

This issue was caused by using a fixed width for the container, combined
with `margin: auto`. This only occurs at higher resolutions where you'd want
the content to be a set size so the page can stretch). The links element
(`aaf-links`) was not nested inside a wrapper which provided this
behaviour — that's why it was breaking. I was able to move the links element
inside a container to provide this.

From some testing in different browsers (Safari, Chrome, Firefox) it all
looks alright.

Resolves https://github.com/ausaccessfed/aaf-lipstick/issues/38.
Reworked for style consistency
Reworked to complement new AAF styling
Update email styles to complement new AAF branding

Merge pull request #42 from ausaccessfed/feature/fix-rubocop-violations

Fix rubocop violations

Merge pull request #34 from ausaccessfed/bugfix/sinatra-example-app

Fix Sinatra example app

Merge pull request #29 from ausaccessfed/bugfix/email-banner-blank-env-string

Fix the behaviour for a blank environment string in an email banner

Merge pull request #27 from ausaccessfed/feature/collection-select

Use Semantic UI for select / collection_select

Merge pull request #26 from ausaccessfed/bugfix/blank-date-picker

Fix behaviour of blank date picker

Merge pull request #23 from ausaccessfed/feature/ci

Enable CI

Merge pull request #21 from ausaccessfed/feature/auto-validation-descriptive-names

Allow customisation of auto validation field names

Merge pull request #22 from ausaccessfed/bugfix/double-list-bullet

Remove explicit bullet style on validation errors

Merge pull request #20 from ausaccessfed/bugfix/multiple-validate-field-calls

Add support for repeat validate_field calls

Merge pull request #17 from ausaccessfed/bugfix/email-message-links

Add test case that proves linking works

delete_button_tag shows matching confirmation

FormHelper#delete_button_tag now uses the provided text in the 'Confirm'
dropdown.

Fixes #7.

Merge pull request #13 from ausaccessfed/feature/validation-enhancements

Validation enhancements

Merge pull request #12 from ausaccessfed/feature/logged-in-user

Add new logged_in_user helper

Merge pull request #11 from ausaccessfed/bugfix/rails-4.2-compatibility

Fix Rails 4.2 compatibility

Interesting how this works with valhammer...

``` ruby
class Organisation < ActiveRecord::Base
  include Lipstick::AutoValidation

  ...
  valhammer

  @lipstick_field_names = {
      name: 'Object Name',
      description: 'Descriptive Text'
  }
```

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9734455/6681351/b984507c-ccb0-11e4-8cf1-cf65b5232131.png)

I'm assuming the `@lipstick_field_names` is just positional? There is no way to specify the field?

I see. The instructions are:

> If you need to override the way a field is described in validation errors,
> assign the names in the `@lipstick_field_names` variable:

Maybe it could be a bit clearer in the instructions? Or maybe I didn't read it correctly.

Maybe just something like this "You may override the way a field is described in validation errors. Specify each override with an entry `fieldname: "description"` in the `@lipstick_field_names` hash." 

... Then give the original example https://github.com/ausaccessfed/aaf-lipstick/pull/21/files#diff-22030a007f43226c6b61f9991ed99a39R269.

review_comments.body: `StringIO` has only two methods to return the size of the buffer string, `size` and `length` and Rubocop suggests to use `!empty?` on the target object. any suggestion ?

that can be possible with a little change, but then I think the `delete_button_tag` will be a little confusing, because usage of helpers with `_tag` suffix  is deferent than helpers with `_to` suffix.
